record.cms_heading: Open to the Possibilities: The Importance of Partner Relationships
record.cms_content:
As travel agents, the need to foster strong relationships with preferred tour operator partners is essential. In this session we hear from the leader of a major operator partner on the importance of the independent trade and how to maximise the value of the business relationship.

Overall Session moderator John Sullivan will outlne wll outline what makes a winning partnership and Lucy will look at business opportunities, trends and challenges in the UK travel industry andimprovements that need to be made. 

Lucy also introduces the panel of: Daniel Levine, Brian Kelly & Julia Lo Bue-Said who will discuss

  • The essence of winning partnerships
  • Defining and managing the pressure points in a relationship
  • What is needed from both partners to make things work
record.speaker1_desc: Serving as an Editor-in-chief at Travel Weekly. Lucy spearheads editorial content across the group's portfolio, including Travel Weekly, Travel Weekly Business, Travolution, Aspire and gazetteers.com. Ms. Huxley joined in 2010, following 12 years at Travel Trade Gazette, the last three as editor. Lucy began reporting on the travel industry in 1998, and counts tour operators, travel agents and cruise among her specialist areas. She started her reporting career at the Kent & Sussex Courier, where she became chief reporter and also launched a satellite edition of the newspaper. She studied geography at Manchester University and a postgraduate degree in newspaper journalism at Harlow College

record.cms_heading: Open Skies: Local agents - Local Airports
record.cms_content:
Without doubt, a good local airport can have a positive influence upon the overall customer experience, getting the holiday off to the right start before the customer even gets there. In this session we look at the role the airport can play in working with the agent to ensure that the customer experience gets off to a flying start.

We will be looking at a number of key things.

  • The development of the relationship between ‘local agents’ and their ‘local airport’
  • Getting right the essential elements of the airport experience
  • Adding value to the overall airport experience
  • Understanding the differing needs of the business traveller and holiday-maker
  • What can we expect/need to enhance the airport experience?
We will be looking at two case studies and hear about their relationships with the local trade.
record.speaker1_name: Andrew Cornish - MD John Lennon Airport

record.cms_heading: Would I Lie To You: What do you actually know about our industry?
record.cms_content:
We all pride ourselves in being travel industry professionals, experts in our field with a broad understanding of travel. But how much do we really know? We challenge a group of well-known industry personalities to put each other’s knowledge to the test.

You'll find in the operator team

  • Carl Burrows: Collette
  • Gordon McCreadie: Dnata
  • Wendy Lahmich: Holland America Line and Seabourn

And in the agent team

  • Jo Dooey: Love to Travel
  • Tony Mann: Idle Travel
  • Neil Basnett: Elite Travel Group
record.speaker1_name: John Sullivan - Head of Commercial and Marketing at Advantage
record.speaker1_desc: John Sullivan, currently Head of Commercial and Marketing at Advantage has been there for the past 7 years. John has worked in a commercial role for the past 15 years and started working in the travel industry at the age of 16 as a travel agent.

record.cms_heading: You Have Got To Be Kidding: What the customers of the future really think about travel
record.cms_content:
We all appreciate that the children of today are the customers of tomorrow but how much do we know about what they want from a holiday and what they think of agents? In a revealing piece of research, we find out what customers of the future really think about travel.

You will listen to Pippa Jacks outlining some very interesting research that has been carried out - not to be missed!
record.speaker1_desc: Pippa is Editor of TTG and has been there for over 8 years overseeing engaging news and features in print online. As a free-lance journalist she has also written travel/lifestyle features for publications including Telegraph.co.uk, Nat Geo Traveller, Greentraveller, Diver Magazine and Australia & New Zealand Magazine. Also regularly appearing on BBC Radio 4's You & Yours consumer affairs programme as a travel expert.

record.cms_heading: Caught on Camera: Vlogging - The Directors Cut
record.cms_content: The influence of social media in shaping opinion and attracting attention is immense and continues to be on the increase. Whilst social media websites lead the way with blogging and tweeting having their role to play, we introduce delegates to the new skill of Vlogging which we think you will like.
record.speaker1_desc:
Dave Cornthwaite is an adventurer, author and motivational speaker. Since quitting his life as a couch potato in 2005 Dave got busy, so far completing eleven non-motorised journeys each over 1000 miles, including skateboarding across Australia, paddleboarding the Mississippi and swimming the Lower Missouri.
He has written 3 books, entertained audiences on 6 continents, broken 9 world records, made hundreds of short films, completed countless quirky projects and is the founder of potential-fulfilling brand SayYesMore.

record.cms_heading: Seeing the Benefits: The Importance of having the right brand
record.cms_content: Why do so many businesses invest so heavily in creating and maintaining a strong brand image – because they know that customers are attracted to brands that connect with them and their values. In this session we will concentrate on the core principles of effective branding and look at examples of how this is seen to work in practice across the membership.
record.speaker1_desc: Geoff Ramm is the creator and author of ‘Celebrity Service’ and ‘OMG Marketing’. He’s a multi-award winning speaker who has challenged and inspired audiences across five continents. With a genuine passion and an infectious love of his subject, he’s humorous with original content and will challenge you to greater results. See the ‘real life’ observational content passionately delivered to enable you to look deeper, think harder and create better, to inevitably stand out from the competition. Geoff sees the stand out customer service and marketing ideas from all over the world that others simply miss. Renowned as the ‘Billy Connolly’ of service and marketing, he receives rave reviews from corporate clients, associations as well as entrepreneurial audiences for his fast-paced, high interaction.rom the competition. Geoff sees the stand out customer service and marketing ideas from all over the world that others simply miss. Renowned as the ‘Billy Connolly’ of service and marketing, he receives rave reviews from corporate clients, associations as well as entrepreneurial audiences for his fast-paced, high interaction.
record.speaker2_desc: Head of Business Development at Advantage
